div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1292 Mugla (anc. Pisye), Caria, 1945 Burial: c. 280 B.E. (M) Contents: 52 AR Alexander III: 14 lifetime and early post. dr. (Abydus 1, Lampsacus 4, Colophon 5, Magnesia 1, Miletus 1, unc. mints 2) Philip III: 1 dr. (Abydus?) Lysimachus: 4 lifetime tetradr. (Aenus 1, Lampsacus 2, Magnesia 1) 1 lifetime dr. (Colophon) Ephesus: 1 tetradr. Rhodes: 26 didr.; 4 dr.; 1 hemidr. Disposition: Ankara (inv. no. 1122) Information from Saadet Taner
